title: Behind Kershaw, L.A. rights ship vs. rival Padres
content: Clayton Kershaw fired six innings of one-run ball to help the Dodgers snap a four-game losing streak Friday night and tie up the NL West again with a 3-2 win over the Padres.

title: Brewers win again behind Uecker-inspired rally
content: Christian Yelich had two homers among his four hits and drove in five runs as the Brewers overcame a seven-run deficit to beat the Reds on Friday night for their club-record-tying 13th straight victory.

title: O's rookie Young flirts with perfection vs. Astros
content: Baltimore rookie right-hander Brandon Young lost his bid for the first perfect game in Orioles history with four outs remaining Friday night in a 7-0 win over the Houston Astros.

title: Titans' Ward happy for 'more reps' on shaky night
content: Titans rookie Cameron Ward, originally set to play two series Friday night, was sent back out after he and the Tennessee offense struggled on the first two series.

title: Plum: ASG jab at Team Clark 'a really bad joke'
content: Sparks guard Kelsey Plum said Friday on Sue Bird's podcast that her remarks after the All-Star Game about members of Team Clark not being present for the "Pay Us What You Owe Us" T-shirt meeting were "a really bad joke" about the players being hungover.

title: 'Hard to describe': Mets get no relief from woes
content: With their 11-9 loss to the Mariners on Friday night, the Mets have now dropped 14 of 16 games to fall six games behind the first-place Phillies in the NL East.

title: At peace after collision, Falcons' Carter breaks out
content: Falcons rookie Nathan Carter attributed his breakout performance Friday night to knowing that the Lions' Morice Norris was doing better one week after the two collided in a preseason game, resulting in a scary injury for Norris.

title: Bryson: PGA Tour's call if I do Ryder Cup tuneup
content: While Bryson DeChambeau said LIV Golf would be OK with him playing a PGA Tour event to prepare for the Ryder Cup, the tour won't let it happen.

title: 📸 Soto's bat tops best of MLB Players' Weekend
content: Players' Weekend allows player to don and use custom gear reflecting three themes: off-field interests, causes and appreciation.

title: Tory Horton, Jaxson Dart, Adonai Mitchell among deep sleepers for 2025
content: These sleepers are truly for those in deeper leagues seeking off-the-radar types who might emerge in 2025.

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC 319
content: Former UFC fighters and analysts give predictions for UFC 319 main event. Ian Parker provides betting advice.

title: Stacking the best, worst positional groups in the NFL: 1-32 rankings, plus roster outlooks
content: Which team has the best wide receivers? The shakiest edge rusher room? We ranked all 32 teams in 10 position groups.

title: Awards tracker: Collier, Bueckers dominate MVP, ROY talk; other races less set
content: Napheesa Collier and Paige Bueckers will be hard to catch while the other player awards have changed front-runners in August.

title: 10 biggest WNBA games that will determine the 2025 playoff race
content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

title: What do NFL scouts think of Arch Manning and what can Texas expect from him this fall?
content: Manning now has the reins of the Longhorns' offense, but what do evaluators think of him entering the season -- and when could he enter the NFL draft?

title: Dive into the ESPN/KFF Survey of 1988 NFL Players
content: Read the key takeaways and methodology of the ESPN/KFF Survey of 1988 NFL Players, and see additional stories and videos from the project.

title: Every matchup from the Celebration Bowl to the national title game
content: It's August and no games have been played, but we're breaking down who will be where in December and beyond.

title: Is Flagg a ROY lock? How 11 rookies can challenge the No. 1 pick
content: NBA analyst Kevin Pelton groups 11 players most likely to threaten the Mavericks' No. 1 pick for the auspicious award.

title: A White House nod boosts the stature of once-shunned MMA
content: Dana White recounts sport's long journey from 'human cockfighting' obscurity to a presidential embrace

title: On an emotional night, Liverpool summon inner strength for dramatic win in Premier League opener
content: In Liverpool's first Premier League match since Diogo Jota's tragic death, late goals from Federico Chiesa and Mohamed Salah sealed victory in an opening match to remember.

title: Premier League mega-preview: Key stats, questions, predictions for all 20 teams
content: Let's predict how each team will finish by assessing how Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool and all the rest look.

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Sargent making early claim to be Pochettino's No. 9
content: While Josh Sargent is scoring early and often in 2025-26, Matt Turner is on the move in search of minutes. ESPN has the latest on the player pool.

title: How Patrick Mahomes raised his game another level for 2025
content: After a Super Bowl loss, Mahomes has wowed teammates and coaches with his accuracy and focus this summer.

title: The Bottom 10 is back! Who will bring up the rear in college football in 2025?
content: If you want national title contenders, look somewhere else. Here, Ryan McGee salutes the best of the worst.

title: 11 second-year players who could break out this season
content: These super sophomores could make a significant impact, including on the College Football Playoff race.

title: The NBA schedule is out! Here are the best games -- and beefs -- to watch this season
content: Following the NBA's schedule release, our insiders break down which 2025-26 games have the most intrigue.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Donnarumma to replace Ederson at City?
content: Manchester City are pondering a move for Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma if Éderson decides to leave. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Jammu And Kashmir Cloudburst Highlights: Rescue Ops On As 46 Killed In Kishtwar, Chief Minister Cancels Independence Day Cultural Events
content: At least 46 people died, including two Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel, after a massive cloudburst struck Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday.

title: Jayant Chaudhary Sends A Message By Abstaining From Constitution Club Polls
content: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief and Union Minister of State Jayant Chaudhary chose to abstain from voting in the Constitution Club of India elections this week, a decision that has created ripples in the political circles.

title: Man Runs From Immigration Officers In US, Dies After Getting Hit By Car
content: A man fleeing immigration authorities outside a Home Depot store in Southern California was struck and killed by an SUV when he ran across a nearby freeway.

title: Who Will Be Next Vice President? A Look At BJP's Probable Candidates
content: With less than a month to go for the Vice Presidential poll, the BJP has begun work in full swing to finalise its nominee and started discussions on its potential picks that include Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

title: PM Modi To Inaugurate Delhi Section Of Dwarka Expressway Tomorrow: Key Details
content: The Dwarka Expressway is set to transform daily commutes with faster connectivity, advanced design features and a direct link to IGI Airport.

title: "Tamil Nadu Will Be Hit Harder": MK Stalin On Trump Tariffs
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, warning that the steep US tariff hikes on Indian imports could deal a crippling blow to the state's export-driven economy.

title: NCERT Blames Jinnah, Congress, Mountbatten As "Culprits Of Partition"
content: A new special module by the National Council of Education Research and Training (NCERT) has blamed three figures as responsible for the Partition of India, including Muhammad Ali Jinnah, the Congress leadership, and then Viceroy Lord Mountbatten.

title: Nine-Year-Old Kerala Girl Dies From Rare Brain-Eating Amoeba Infection
content: A nine-year-old girl who died at the medical college here two days ago was due to amoebic encephalitis, a rare brain infection caused by free-living amoeba in contaminated waters, health officials in this north Kerala district confirmed on Saturday.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's Emotional Instagram Post As He Heads Back To India
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla has penned a moving Instagram post capturing his emotions as he heads home after completing his space mission.

title: Air Canada Flights Suspended After 10,000 Crew Members Go On Strike
content: Air Canada's flight attendants went on strike Saturday, as the airline announced a complete shutdown of operations, creating summer travel chaos for its 130,000 daily passengers.

title: 40 Indians Hospitalised After Drinking Toxic Alcohol In Kuwait
content: Kuwait's health ministry said 63 people had suffered methanol poisoning from contaminated alcoholic drinks in the five days to Wednesday, resulting in 13 deaths and 21 cases of blindness or impaired vision.

title: Mumbai Woman, 71, Loses Rs 18 Lakh While Attempting To Order Milk Online
content: A 71-year-old woman from Mumbai allegedly lost Rs 18.5 lakh from her bank accounts while attempting to order a litre of milk online, police said on Saturday.

title: BJP Plans Mega Show Of Strength Ahead Of Vice Presidential Election
content: The BJP is planning a mega huddle of its top leaders and closest allies next week, in a major show of strength before the upcoming Vice-Presidential election.

title: Zelensky To Meet Trump On Monday After US President's Summit With Putin
content: Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky will head to Washington on Monday to discuss "ending the killing and the war" with US President Donald Trump.

title: Over 320 Killed In Flash Floods In Pakistan, Rescue Ops Underway
content: Rescuers were struggling to retrieve bodies from debris after flash floods triggered by heavy monsoon rains across northern Pakistan killed at least 321 people in the past 48 hours.

title: Alaska Meet Live Updates: After Putin Meeting, Ukraine's Zelensky To Meet Trump In Washington On Monday
content: Trump-Putin Alaska Meet Live Updates: Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, did not reach a deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine after talks in Alaska.

title: New Study Could Boost IVF Success: 3D Video Shows How Embryos Implant
content: Scientists have recorded a real-time 3D video of a human embryo implanting into the uterus for the first time. They have used a synthetic uterus model to show how the process happens naturally in the body.

title: Key Highway Submerged As Rain Disrupts Road Connectivity In Odisha
content: Incessant rainfall over the past 48 hours has triggered a flood-like situation in Odisha's Malkangiri district, severely disrupting road connectivity to neighbouring states Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

title: Cab Driver Who Held Family "Hostage" To Outrun Noida Cops Arrested
content: A cab driver has been arrested after he held a family "hostage" during their ride as Noida Police chased the speeding car for deliberately jumping barricades, officials said on Saturday.

title: He Was Complaining Over Flood Rescue Hurdles, Then Omar Abdullah Arrived
content: Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district has turned into a site of outpouring grief, as families wait anxiously for the bodies of their loved ones who were killed or buried alive under the slush during Thursday's flash flood.

title: No ceasefire, straight to peace deal? Trump to meet Zelenskyy; may talk to Putin 'if all works out'
content: Following a meeting in Alaska, President Trump announced his preference for a direct peace agreement to end the Russia-Ukraine war, rather than a ceasefire. Zelenskyy is scheduled to visit Washington D.C. on Monday, with a potential meeting with Putin to follow if discussions progress positively. Both leaders have expressed openness to negotiations, signaling a potential path toward resolving the conflict.

title: Talks on border issue: Chinese FM Wang Yi to visit India next week
content: "At the invitation of national security advisor Shri Ajit Doval, Member of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China and Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi will visit India on 18-19 August 2025," the MEA stated in a release.

title: 'Chess doesn't fit women properly': How Divya plans to defy Kasparov's 36-yo remark
content: In 1989, Garry Kasparov claimed women were weaker fighters in chess. Judit Polgár proved him wrong, crossing 2700. Now, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh, fresh off her Women’s World Cup triumph and Grandmaster title, is stepping into the Open Grand Swiss 2025. Backed by coach Shyam Sundar, her bold move echoes Polgár’s path and signals higher ambitions.

title: '10/10' Alaska meeting: Inconclusive Trump-Putin talks leave India in limbo; here's how
content: The Alaska meeting between Trump and Putin concluded without a clear agreement, despite Trump's positive assessment. Putin emphasized addressing Russia's concerns, including Nato expansion, before any peace deal. Trump hinted at potential secondary tariffs on India for Russian oil purchases but deferred immediate action, leaving New Delhi uncertain about its trade relations.

title: ‘Some people came...’: ‘The Bengal Files’ trailer launch disrupted
content: A controversy erupted in Kolkata during the trailer release of ‘The Bengal Files.’ Actress Pallavi Joshi alleged disruption, questioning freedom of expression in West Bengal and comparing the situation unfavorably to Kashmir. Director Vivek Agnihotri condemned the incident as dictatorship, citing disrupted event arrangements.

title: Tech Hiring: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on how AI has changed hiring for engineering jobs; We are ...
content: Google is reintroducing in-person interviews due to widespread AI-powered cheating during virtual hiring, as revealed by CEO Sundar Pichai. This decision comes after concerns raised by employees about compromised software engineering interviews. Other major corporations like Amazon, Anthropic, Cisco, McKinsey and Deloitte are also implementing anti-cheating measures, signaling an industry-wide shift away from fully virtual recruitment.

title: ICC U19 World Cup 2026: Full line-up confirmed, USA seal final spot
content: The USA secured the final spot in the ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2026, joining 15 other teams in Zimbabwe and Namibia. They dominated the Americas Qualifier, led by Arjun Mahesh, while Tanzania, Afghanistan, Japan, and Scotland also qualified through regional tournaments. The event promises to showcase future stars, blending traditional powerhouses with emerging talents.

title: How Goa managed to tame rabies: Inside state's drive that vaccinated 63k dogs in 30 days
content: Goa achieved a "rabies-controlled" status in 2021 after eliminating human rabies cases since 2017, following a 2014 outbreak that claimed 17 lives. Mission Rabies initiated mass vaccination and sterilization drives, significantly reducing cases. Cross-border transmission from neighboring states remains a challenge, prompting intensified vaccination efforts in border regions and mandatory pet vaccination declarations for visitors.

title: ‘Finally woken up’: Cong demands discussion on GST 2.0 announced by PM
content: Following PM Modi's GST reform announcement, Congress demands a discussion paper, advocating for a simplified tax structure. Jairam Ramesh suggests rate reductions and extending the GST compensation cess to aid states. PM Modi plans GST revisions around Diwali, promising relief to consumers and small businesses by reducing tax rates on essential goods.

title: Apple founder Steve Jobs lived by the rule that God is in …
content: Steve Jobs, the Apple founder, was a firm believer in the philosophy that "God is in the details," shaping Apple's DNA through meticulous attention to even the smallest design elements. His relentless pursuit of perfection, extending to hidden components, pushed teams to innovate and create exceptional products.

title: ‘Russia lost an oil client, which is India’: What Trump said before meeting Putin
content: US President Trump imposed a 25% tariff on India for its Russian crude oil trade, claiming it cost Russia a major client. Trump's remarks came after his recent decision to implement a 50% tariff on India’s exports to the US, citing India's oil trade with Russia as the reason.

title: Jason Whitlock sides with Dave Portnoy in brutal critique of Hailee Steinfeld’s Sinners
content: Hailee Steinfeld's movie 'Sinners' faces criticism despite its financial success. Dave Portnoy's remarks ignited debate, with Jason Whitlock agreeing. Some praise the film's style, performances, and world-building. Others find it overrated. Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld were seen shopping. Allen prepares for the Buffalo Bills' season opener against the Baltimore Ravens. 'Sinners' continues to spark discussion.

title: Tech layoffs: Cisco CEO says, I don’t use AI to cut jobs; I just want engineers to ...
content: Cisco Systems is embracing AI to boost engineer productivity and gain a competitive edge, contrasting with peers using AI for job cuts. CEO Chuck Robbins emphasizes innovation over workforce reduction. Cisco's AI infrastructure focus drives strong earnings, exceeding expectations with significant orders from major tech companies, despite a slight stock dip due to security segment weakness.

title: 'Like doomsday': Pak floods wreak havoc; over 320 killed; video captures devastation
content: Devastating flash floods in Pakistan, triggered by intense monsoon rains, have claimed at least 321 lives in the last 48 hours. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province is the worst hit, with entire villages destroyed and communities cut off. Rescue efforts are underway, but hampered by washed-out roads and ongoing rainfall.

title: 'Chori chori, chupke chupke': Rahul shares new video as part of 'vote theft' campaign; watch
content: Rahul Gandhi intensified his criticism of the Election Commission, employing a parody video to highlight alleged vote theft. The Congress party has launched a "Vote Chori se Azaadi" campaign and announced a "VoterAdhikarYatra" from Bihar, directly challenging perceived electoral manipulation.

title: 'Historic first': Tricolour hoisted at Seattle’s iconic 605-feet-tall Space Needle; watch
content: In a historic moment, the Indian flag flew atop Seattle's Space Needle on Independence Day. Consul General Prakash Gupta and Mayor Bruce Harrell attended the event. Several iconic buildings were illuminated in tricolour. King County and other cities declared August 15 as India Day. The event highlighted the strong ties between India and the US Pacific Northwest.

title: 'Congress caused partition': NCERT's new module blames party for 'blunders'; key extracts
content: NCERT's new modules on the Partition of India place significant responsibility on the Congress leadership. The modules assert that Congress leaders accepted Partition plans, underestimated Jinnah's influence, and failed to anticipate the long-term consequences of the division. The material highlights Jinnah's demands and warnings as key factors that led to the Partition, questioning the haste in transferring power.

title: F-1 visa rejections explained: What’s fuelling student refusals; how you can avoid them
content: Many international students face F-1 visa denials under Section 214(b) due to perceived lack of ties to their home country. This refusal isn't permanent, and applicants can reapply with strengthened evidence of these ties, such as family commitments or property ownership. The DIGNITY Act, if approved, may ease restrictions by allowing dual intent for F-1 visas.

title: 'War 2' box office: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara starrer crosses Rs 100 cr mark; Janmashtami may hit day 3 biz
content: Released on August 14th, 'War 2' clashed with 'Coolie' at the box office. Despite a weaker opening day with ₹51.5 crore compared to 'Coolie's' ₹65 crore, 'War 2' surged on Independence Day, collecting ₹56.50 crore. The film has crossed ₹100 crore in two days, fueled by Hindi belt growth and Jr NTR's Telugu version success.

title: 1999 Saudi murder case: CBI nabs fugitive at Delhi airport; lived 25 yrs under fake ID
content: Mohammad Dilshad, a fugitive wanted for a 1999 murder in Saudi Arabia, was apprehended by the CBI at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after evading authorities for over two decades. The arrest followed a request from Saudi Arabian authorities and a CBI investigation that uncovered Dilshad's use of a fake passport to travel abroad.

title: Mumbai rains: Heavy downpour floods streets, railway tracks flooded, red alert sounded
content: Mumbai grappled with heavy rainfall on Saturday, leading to waterlogged streets and a tragic landslide in Vikhroli that claimed two lives and injured two others. The IMD has issued a red alert for Mumbai and neighboring districts, forecasting continued intense rainfall. In Himachal Pradesh, the monsoon death toll has reached 257, with widespread disruptions to roads and essential services.

title: Kangana Ranaut on live-in hypocrisy: ‘Men can impregnate and run’; reacts after Khushboo Patani’s criticism
content: Amidst the ongoing debate on live-in relationships sparked by controversial remarks, Kangana Ranaut shares her perspective, emphasizing the importance of marriage in society. She highlights the promise of loyalty a man makes to his wife and suggests that live-in relationships may not be as woman-friendly as they seem.

title: 'Tu kab se mera baap ban gaya?': How Irfan Pathan shut an abusive Afridi
content: Irfan Pathan revealed a heated exchange with Shahid Afridi during a 2006 flight from Karachi to Lahore. Afridi's initial taunt led to a verbal altercation, escalating when Pathan jokingly inquired about dog meat, implying Afridi had consumed it.

title: ‘Ordered milk, lost Rs 18.5 lakh’: Mumbai woman duped in online scam
content: A 71-year-old woman in Mumbai was defrauded of Rs 18.5 lakh after attempting to order milk online. She received a call from a scammer posing as a milk company executive, who tricked her into clicking a link and sharing her banking details. Consequently, the fraudster emptied her three bank accounts, leading to a significant financial loss.

title: 'Will you stop killing civilians?': How reporters put Putin on the spot with questions in Alaska; watch
content: In Alaska, President Trump and President Putin engaged in over two and a half hours of discussions primarily focused on the Russia-Ukraine war. Putin faced pointed questions from reporters about civilian casualties and trust. Following the talks, both leaders expressed optimism about a potential path to peace in Ukraine, though specifics of their agreement remained undisclosed.

title: 'Not like they wanted to leave': Ex-India bowler on Kohli, Rohit retirements
content: Karsan Ghavri alleges that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were compelled to retire prematurely from Test cricket due to internal politics within the BCCI and the selection committee. Ghavri claims that both players desired to continue playing, but were forced out, and Kohli was not even given a farewell.

title: The Trump-Putin Alaska summit explained: A real-time history lesson for students on world affairs
content: In 2025, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin met in Anchorage, Alaska. Alaska's location is significant due to its history and strategic importance. The summit aimed to address the war in Ukraine. Past US-Russia summits tackled nuclear arms and security. This meeting highlights ongoing challenges in diplomacy. It shows how nations negotiate and sometimes clash.

title: Manipur: 3 women among 5 militants arrested; arms and ammunition seized
content: Security forces in Manipur arrested five militants, including three women from the KCP (Taibanganba), in Thoubal and Imphal East districts. Separately, a PREPAK (PRO) cadre was apprehended. Authorities also seized arms and ammunition during a search operation in Imphal East. The governor highlighted ongoing security efforts to curb extortion and the seizure of over 3,000 firearms in recent months.

title: Alaska summit: ‘Productive’ talks but 'no deal' on Ukraine - 10 takeaways from Trump-Putin meet
content: Despite warm gestures and ceremonial honors, the summit between Trump and Putin in Alaska yielded no concrete agreements, though both leaders expressed optimism and hinted at future contact. Putin's visit marked a return to the global stage after years of isolation, while Trump faced criticism for legitimizing a leader accused of war crimes.

title: In pictures: MS Dhoni, Gautam Gambhir, Rohit Sharma, Suniel Shetty clicked at wedding
content: Gautam Gambhir and MS Dhoni were seen in cheerful conversation together at a wedding. The event became a reunion for Indian cricketers. Rohit Sharma and Harbhajan Singh also attended. Many other cricketers were present at the function. Bollywood stars like Kriti Sanon and Suniel Shetty also joined the celebration. The Dhoni-Gambhir picture became viral  on social media as well.

title: 'Make a deal': Trump’s blunt message to Zelenskyy after meeting Putin
content: Following a lengthy meeting with Vladimir Putin, Donald Trump asserted that resolving the Ukraine conflict hinges on Volodymyr Zelenskyy's willingness to negotiate. Trump suggested that European nations should also play a role and expressed his availability to participate in future discussions between Zelenskyy and Putin, indicating a high likelihood of reaching an agreement.

title: Armaan Malik’s second wife pregnant: Kritika shares news; Patiala court issues summon
content: YouTuber Armaan Malik, already facing legal trouble for allegedly violating the Hindu Marriage Act with two wives, now sees his second wife, Kritika, announce her pregnancy. This news arrives amidst a court summons for Armaan and his wives, Payal and Kritika, following accusations of polygamy.

title: “I Deserve a Chance”: Nazem Kadri fires back after Hockey Canada camp snub
content: Nazem Kadri expressed disappointment at not being invited to Hockey Canada's Olympic orientation camp, despite a strong recent performance. He highlighted his impressive stats, including a 35-goal season, and emphasized his winning experience. Kadri also addressed trade rumors linking him to Toronto, while reaffirming his commitment to earning an Olympic roster spot through continued production.

title: Mumbai shocker: Pregnant Bangladeshi prisoner escapes from JJ Hospital; search on
content: Rubina Irshad Shaikh, a 21-year-old Bangladeshi woman arrested for illegal stay in India, escaped from Mumbai's JJ Hospital. She pushed aside a police constable while receiving treatment for fever and skin ailments after being transferred from Byculla Women’s Jail.

title: ‘Maybe in 2-3 weeks’: What Trump said on tariffs over Russian oil after meeting Putin
content: Following his meeting with Vladimir Putin in Alaska, US President Donald Trump talked about his resolve on imposing tariffs on countries purchasing Russian oil in the coming weeks. While no agreements were signed during the three-hour closed-door meeting, both leaders expressed cautious optimism regarding US-Russia relations and the conflict in Ukraine.

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: 60 dead, 100 injured, several trapped; rescue ops continue for 3rd day
content: A devastating cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district has claimed the lives of at least 60 people, with over 100 injured. Rescue operations are underway, involving multiple agencies and local volunteers, as authorities work to identify victims and locate the missing. The disaster struck near the Machail Mata shrine, destroying infrastructure and prompting the suspension of the annual pilgrimage.

title: Noida horror ride: Family held ‘hostage’ in cab as driver tries to escape cops; arrested
content: A Noida couple and their daughter were held captive in an Uber cab when the driver, Nasim, attempted to evade a police check. Ignoring their pleas, Nasim sped away, colliding with another car during the chase. He was later apprehended, and Uber has removed his access to their platform after the family was released on Sector 66 road.

title: Not Virat or Rohit - Irfan Pathan names the player who wanted him out of IPL commentary
content: Irfan Pathan revealed that Hardik Pandya, not Virat Kohli or Rohit Sharma, raised concerns about his on-air criticism during the Australia Test series in December 2024, leading to his removal from the IPL 2025 broadcast team.

title: Lamborghini debuts Fenomeno; Winkelmann explains why V12 isn’t done yet
content: Lamborghini unveiled the Fenomeno at Monterey Car Week 2025, a limited-run model celebrating Centro Stile's 20th anniversary. CEO Stephan Winkelmann announced the production of 29 units, priced between 3 and 3.5 million euros. The Fenomeno boasts a 1,064 hp hybrid powertrain, achieving 0-100 kmph in 2.4 seconds and a top speed exceeding 350 kmph.

title: Vajpayee’s death anniversary: PM pays tribute; calls him guiding force for self-reliant India
content: PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his death anniversary. He acknowledged Vajpayee's service to India. PM Modi said his contributions continued to inspire the nation.Several Union ministers visited Sadaiv Atal, Vajpayee’s memorial in Delhi. Kiren Rijiju, Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, Sanjay Jha, and Rekha Gupta were present. Vajpayee, the first BJP prime minister, passed away in 2018.

title: Happy Krishna Janmashtami 2025: Best wishes, messages, quotes, pictures to share
content: Janmashtami, celebrating Lord Krishna's birth, will be observed on August 15 and 16. Festivities include temple decorations, midnight prayers, and the Dahi Handi tradition. Devotees focus on Krishna's teachings of love, duty, and inner awakening, sharing wishes and images of the celebrations. Homes will be filled with devotion, fasting, and stories of Krishna's life.

title: Patna horror: 2 children found dead inside parked car in Indrapuri; probe on
content: In Patna's Indrapuri area, tragedy struck as two children, a girl aged around nine and a boy about five, were discovered deceased inside a parked car on Friday evening. Police responded to a 112 call and found one child alive, but the child later died in hospital.

title: 'War 2' box office collection day 2: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR starrer crosses Rs 100 crore
content: Ayan Mukerji's 'WAR 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani, had a strong opening, boosted significantly by its Telugu version. Despite mixed reviews, the film experienced substantial growth on Independence Day, particularly in its Hindi version, which saw a 50% jump. The movie crossed ₹100 crore in two days, although Telugu collections dipped slightly on the second day.

title: Need to consult experts for risk mitigation, says Jammu & Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah pointing to recent calamities in Himalayas
content: Talking to reporters near Chisoti on his return to this cloudburst-hit remote village in Kishtwar district, he said the entire Himalayan belt is now more prone to glacial lake bursts and cloudbursts

title: Rahul to launch ‘Vote Adhikar Yatra’ in Bihar on August 17
content: Former state Congress president Akhilesh Prasad Singh said Rahul Gandhi is likely to be in Bihar for over a fortnight till the ‘Vote Adhikar Yatra’ concludes.

title: Revisiting Katou-Indel in 17th-century botanical treatise Hortus Malabaricus yields new finds for researchers
content: Recent studies on the palm, named Katou-Indel in Hortus Malabaricus, have led researchers to conclude that the trees found in Kerala and Sri Lanka and elsewhere in India and neighbouring Bangladesh and Pakistan are two distinct species of the genus Phoenix

title: Three arrested in fraud case, bank accounts frozen
content: The accused established Upix Creations, an animation company, at Satyanarayanapuram area and collected about ₹350 crore from 183 depositors and duped them, the police said

title: Heavy rains in Kerala: IMD issues orange alert in 5 districts
content: Orange alert for Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Kannur and Kasaragod districts. Yellow alert for remaining nine districts on Saturday

title: Heavy rain likely in parts of Rajasthan in coming days
content: Parts of Kota, Ajmer, Jaipur, Bharatpur and Bikaner divisions are likely to experience light to moderate rain accompanied by thunder

title: Indian tricolour hoisted atop Seattle’s iconic Space Needle in historic first
content: Consul General of India in Seattle Prakash Gupta along with Mayor of Seattle Bruce Harrell and other select dignitaries from the Seattle city leadership joined the historic and landmark occasion

title: CPI (M) general secretary M.A. Baby visits Polavaram-displaced tribal pockets in Andhra Pradesh
content: The two-day field visit aimed at having a glance of the tribals, R&R colonies and Polavaram irrigation project across river Godavari

title: Zonal commissioners to oversee waste management in Bengaluru
content: Under the new arrangement, although the BSWML will continue to handle waste collection and transportation, the entire process will be overseen by the zonal commissioners

title: Governors are not aliens, but checks on States’ ‘hasty legislation’: Centre to Supreme Court
content: SC’s imposition of timelines, when none exist, on President, Governors to deal with State Bills amounts to amendment of the Constitution: Centre submits in Presidential Reference; TN counters that the Reference cannot be used to nullify the binding judgment in Tamil Nadu Governor case

title: Massive traffic jam at Muringoor on Ernakulam-Thrissur highway in Kerala after lorry accident
content: Long traffic snarl remains for hours and alternative routes have been suggested for airport-bound passengers

title: Bombay High Court orders SIT probe into custodial death of Dalit law student
content: The Aurangabad Bench of the Bombay High Court dissolves earlier inquiry panel; says constitutional rights “prima facie violated” in Somnath Suryawanshi case.

title: Flash flood threat in Telangana’s Adilabad and Nirmal districts valid till 5.30 p.m. August 16
content: The IMD has clarified that the bulletin is only a guidance document and not a direct flash flood warning

title: Woman passenger injured, falls unconscious as KSRTC bus hits pothole in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: Passengers say the incident was caused not only by the poor condition of the road stretch but also by the bus driver’s rash driving

title: Body of Sub-Inspector recovered in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharswan
content: Officer-in-Charge of RIT police station Sanjeev Kumar Singh said the Sub-Inspector’s body was found with blood oozing out of the nose and ears

title: No friction between BJP, RSS: Ram Madhav praises PM's Independence Day address; reiterates ideological unity
content: Ram Madhav praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for recognising the 100-year history of the RSS during his Independence Day speech.

title: NIA takes terror-suspect, woman accomplice into custody from two districts of Andhra Pradesh
content: As per sources in the police, the Central agencies had detected the frequent communication between Mohammad and suspected Pakistani terrorist outfits through some social media platforms

title: Shubhanshu Shukla to return to India on August 19, to meet PM Modi
content: Shubhanshu Shukla is expected to be back in the capital to participate in the National Space Day celebrations on August 22-23

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan slams PM Modi for ‘glorifying’ RSS in Independence Day address
content: In a strongly worded statement, Pinarayi says Centre belittled Independence Day by attempting to fete RSS which he states was ‘unabashedly servile to the colonial rulers and repeatedly betrayed the freedom movement’

title: Family held hostage in taxi as cabbie attempts to outrun cops in Noida, accused held
content: PCR sirens blaring in the background, a four-year-old frightened girl crying, and her parents pleading with the driver to stop the vehicle — showed a video of the nerve-racking incident recorded by the family.

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: J&K CM Omar Abdullah reaches Chasoti village to assess damage
content: A coordinated rescue and relief operation is underway in the village where 75 people have been reported missing

title: Public has woken up: Rahul Gandhi shares new video highlighting ‘vote theft’
content: The minute-long video is titled ‘laapata vote’ with ‘ladies’ cut out from between, a reference to the Kiran Rao-directed movie ‘Laapata Ladies’

title: Govt implements ₹3,000 FASTag pass for private vehicles
content: The annual pass is applicable to all non-commercial vehicles with a valid FASTag and gets activated within two hours of the one-time fee payment

title: Jharkhand Governor Santosh Kumar Gangwar, MLAs pay homage to Education Minister Ramdas Soren
content: The mortal remains of Ramdas Soren were brought to Ranchi and kept on the Assembly premises for people to pay homage. Governor Gangwar paid floral tributes to Soren's mortal remains on the Assembly premises

title: Thar SUV runs over biker, second fatal incident this month in Delhi
content: The driver of the Thar fled immediately after the incident. Legal action is being taken, and multiple teams have been formed to apprehend him, a senior police officer said

title: Three killed, seven injured as bus hits truck parked on roadside near Yellapur in Karnataka
content: Following a complaint by one of the passengers, the Yellapur police have registered a case against the driver of the bus and also that of the truck

title: CBI arrests man for murder in Saudi Arabia in 1999
content: According to officials, Dilshad, who worked as a heavy motor mechanic and security guard in Riyadh, allegedly murdered an individual at his place of work in 1999

title: Dharmasthala burial case: Political temperature soars as no major recovery after digging 17 spots
content: The BJP, which tried to corner the government of Karnataka in the ongoing legislature session, has planned a protest in the pilgrim town claiming the Congress-led State Government us ‘hurting religious sentiment’

title: Want GST 2.0 to be Good and Simple Tax not Growth Suppressing Tax: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge of communications, Jairam Ramesh, said that for well over a year and a half at least, the party has been calling for a radically transformed GST 2.0

title: Kerala Film Producers’ Association election not held in democratic manner, alleges filmmaker Vinayan
content: In a Facebook post, Vinayan alleges that even a person who supported his nomination to the post of general secretary could not cast his vote owing to threat and offers from a section that had been in power for long

title: Seven airports in Karnataka were operationalised under UDAN scheme connecting 118 routes
content: Under UDAN 5.2, bids have been received for small aircraft operations for Ballari and Kolar airstrips

title: CM Nitish Kumar announces 'special economic packages' for investors to promote investments in Bihar
content: In addition, several other provisions have been made to significantly assist entrepreneurs setting up industries in Bihar. “A detailed notification will be issued separately,” CM Nitish Kumar said

title: Tricolour hoisted in 4 tribal hamlets in north Maharashtra for the first time since Independence
content: The hamlet, around 500 km from Mumbai and about 50 km from the nearest tehsil, has a population of 400, but has no government school

title: Two killed in landslip; heavy overnight rains inundate parts of Mumbai, suburbs; local train services hit
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert, forecasting heavy to very heavy rainfall in the metropolis for two days

title: Delhi Police registers case in collapse of structure at dargah near Humayun's Tomb
content: A senior police officer said a case under section 290 (negligent conduct with respect to pulling down, repairing or constructing buildings), 125 (acts that endanger human life or personal safety), and 106 (causing death by negligence) has been registered against unknown people.

title: ₹14.13 crore frozen in accounts of Congress MLA Satish Sail after ED raids related to illegal export of iron ore from Karnataka
content: During the search, incriminating evidence in the form of documents, e-mails, and records were seized, ED stated in a statement on August 15

title: ED conducts searches at T.N. Minister I. Periyasamy’s residences, other linked premises in Chennai, Dindigul
content: The officers from the ED also conducted simultaneous searches at the houses of Periyasamy’s son, an MLA, and daughter

title: Dark clouds fail to deter the spirits of people at Red Fort on the 79th Independence Day
content: The guests ranged from the Indian contingent of Special Olympics 2025 and village sarpanches, to beneficiaries of Lakhpati Didi scheme, and best-performing interns under the PM internship scheme.

title: Maharashtra Health Department integrates TB screening into medical college family adoption programmes
content: The move comes after Bharati Vidyapeeth Medical College in Maharashtra’s Pune and the District TB Unit ran a pilot programme in rural Pune villages, integrating ACF activities, including community screening for TB through door-to-door visits

title: The themes that drive Tamil theatre
content: From puranic tales and nationalist dramas to political satires and tech-driven experiments, Chennai’s stages were influenced by its social and cultural shifts; today, venues such as the Medai and Sangamam keep the scene vibrant; yet, shrinking performances and rehearsal spaces remain a concern

title: Seventh death anniversary of Vajpayee: PM Modi leads nation in paying tributes
content: Several other dignitaries, including President Droupadi Murmu, Union Ministers and Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, visited his memorial 'Sadaiv Atal' to pay tributes to the BJP stalwart

title: Jharkhand Education Minister and JMM leader Ramdas Soren passes away
content: State government announced one day of state mourning. Political leaders cutting across party lines paid tribute to the departed soul. CM Hemant Soren and Governor Santosh Kumar Gangwar also condoled his death

title: Two children found dead inside parked car in Patna
content: Police received information that the bodies of two children — a girl and a boy — were found inside a car in Indrapuri locality. Officials immediately reached the spot and recovered the bodies, says Patna (Central) SP Diksha

title: India monsoon LIVE: Heavy rains predicted across several States, IMD issues alerts; two killed in landslip amid heavy rains in Mumbai
content: IMD Mumbai issued a warning of intense rain, thunderstorms, and gusty winds (30–40 kmph) in parts of north and central Maharashtra, including Nashik, Dhule, Jalgaon, Aurangabad region, Beed, and Nanded.

title: How inclusive is the Election Commission of India’s special revision exercise?
content: A survey conducted in Assam, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal and the National Capital Territory of Delhi shows that the SIR’s document requirements are too onerous for most voters; the exercise could lead to a high possibility of voter exclusion

title: U.S., India will rise to modern challenges together: Secretary Rubio in Independence Day message for India
content: Rubio said, working together, the United States and India will rise to the modern challenges of today and ensure a brighter future for both our countries.

title: On Independence day, Nitish announces to reduce fee to ₹100 for the preliminary test of the all competitive exams
content: In his address, Bihar CM said that the government has developed all sections from the very beginning be it Hindu, Muslim, upper caste, backward, extremely backward, Dalit and Mahadalit.

title: Odisha announces 21 NACs to boost infrastructure and services under urbanisation
content: The State government follows a policy of zero tolerance towards crimes against women, says CM Mohan Majhi

title: In pictures: Tumult in the Himalayas
content: This collection of images stand as a record of some of the worst disasters Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh have witnessed.

title: Shooting spots: an iconic landmark that lends grandeur to the silver screen
content: The grandeur of the Valluvar Kottam has been featured in several other Tamil films since 1980s; One of the most memorable on-screen moments shot on its premises is the one from the timeless song Mounamana Neram in the Tamil film Salangai Oli, starring Kamal Haasan and Jaya Prada

title: 5 km of OMR to be relaid by the end of September
content: This portion will be handed over to TNRDC once Metro rail works are over. Rajiv Gandhi Salai will be completely relaid once the rest of it is handed over to TNRDC after one-and-a-half years

title: 35 omni-buses fined for overcharging passengers; one impounded in city
content: Officials of the Transport and Road Safety Commissionerate undertook surprise inspections of omni-bus stands to prevent bus operators from fleecing passengers headed for their native places

title: Statues of Chennai: an enduring symbol of labour union movement
content: A replica of a statue installed in Delhi, the ‘Triumph of Labour’ depicts workers toiling to raise a rock, and cost ₹50,000

title: The death of a lake, and recurring flood nightmare in Warangal
content: In Warangal, lakes that once tamed the rains are now being choked by concrete and encroachments. As floodwaters swallowed streets and colonies again this August, the city’s rapid urbanisation and neglect of its ancient water systems stood exposed

title: Accidents with elderly at the wheel reignite push for age-based restrictions
content: Two recent mishaps involved motorists in their 80s; experts call for regular medical tests, skill assessments and awareness campaigns to help improve road safety for older drivers

title: The day a village in Uttarkashi disappeared
content: On August 5, a deluge of rain that led to a landslide and flooding flattened the village of Dharali in Uttarakhand. So far, only one body has been retrieved and 69 people remain missing. Rescue teams are battling challenging conditions to do their work. Many, in this village of less than 1,000 people, have lost lives and livelihoods in the tragedy, reports Ishita Mishra

title: Leopard injures 12-year-old boy at Bengaluru’s Bannerghatta Biological Park
content: Environment Minister Eshwar Khandre expresses shock over the incident, instructs officials to install mesh on the windows of all safari vehicles at BBP

title: Reel shoots on railway tracks under scanner
content: ‘Complaints from residents, rail passengers, and traders are on the rise over the unsafe and reckless behaviour by youngsters near tracks for photography and videography’

title: Women are key drivers of India’s growth, says PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi also praised the transformative role of women’s self-help groups (SHGs), saying that programmes like the ‘NaMo Drone Didi’ have given rural women a new identity

title: Hours before Putin-Trump talks, Zelenskyy hopes for Indian help in ending Russia-Ukraine war
content: In Independence Day message to India, Ukraine President says India and Ukraine have stood up for ‘freedom and dignity’

title: Government proposal in 2024 for a panel on ‘demographic challenges’ never took off
content: In her Interim Budget speech on February 1, 2024, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the committee will be formed to consider the challenges arising from “fast population growth and demographic changes”

title: Researcher arrested for plotting attack on Bengal Minister’s Car remanded to police custody
content: On Friday, when the researcher was produced before Alipore Court, the government pleader said that even though Hindol Majumdar was away in Spain, he was the prime conspirator in the attack on the Minister’s car in March 2025

title: ‘We thought it was a bomb blast, and were shaking like a leaf’
content: While the count of injured stands at nine, the blast could have been far more devastating, as it occurred in a cluster of 17 houses — each no larger than 10 feet by 10 feet, occupied by 60 residents

title: ‘My idea is always to rely less on human witnesses and more on scientific evidence’
content: The head of the SIT investigating the Prajwal Revanna case shares insights into the high-profile cases he dealt with, including the murders of Gauri Lankesh and M.M. Kalburgi

title: British retailer Tesco to set up distribution centre; to create 15,000 additional jobs in Karnataka
content: Rolls-Royce, another UK-based company, is also actively exploring fresh investments to further its presence in the State

title: Will go to Delhi and speak to high command to know the reason for sacking: Rajanna
content: ‘I might have spoken certain truth. I will go to Delhi and try to find out [about the easons for my sacking]’

title: Sanjay Raut calls PM Modi ‘Congressvadi’, slams for using Swadeshi in speech
content: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut criticises PM Modi’s Independence Day speech, accusing him of becoming “Congressvadi” and creating communal divide

title: Why Liverpool signed Giovanni Leoni, and how he fits with the Reds
content: a £26 million signing of centre back Giovanni Leoni from Serie A side Parma has bolstered their defensive line . the 18-year-old is still just dipping his toes in the pool of top-level senior football . but the reds have seen enough from 14 league starts to sanction a quick move .

title: Show of force by US: B-2 bomber thundered across skies over Putin’s head in Alaska; watch
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers . read more ‘Coolie’ star Shruti Haasan turns heads with her stunning style momentse Aishwarya Khare’s off-screen chic looks In pic: Radiant pictures of Shrutin

title: NFL preseason Week 2 takeaways: Seahawks' Zach Charbonnet, Titans' Elic Ayomanor come up big
content: the second week of the 2025 preseason kicked off on friday as several teams prepare to give extended looks to their starters in a dress rehearsal for the regular season . the team's reporters summarized the games below to keep you updated on how teams fared .

title: From nobody to a star: South Carolina QB LaNorris Sellers is making a name for himself
content: laNorris Sellers and DJ lagway are two quarterbacks to keep an eye on during the college football season . Sellers took the gamecocks to the brink of the College Football Playoff . the QB is taking selfies and signing autographs everywhere he goes .

title: Little League, big dreams: Mets, Mariners players as Little Leaguers
content: the 2025 Little League World Series is underway . some of the best young players around the country will make it . this year's baseball Little League Classic between the Seattle Mariners and New York Mets will feature a number of baseball players .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: From 'KGB' to Central Michigan: What we learned, and didn't learn, from the Michigan report
content: Connor Stalions referred to his advanced sign-stealing operation as both "counterintelligence" and "the KGB" the former Michigan staffer called the video it elicited "dirty film" and ultimately threw his phone in a pond . the punishments for that operation arrived on Friday .

title: Augusta National ditches the masses in a quest for higher revenues
content: the 2026 "Official Masters Hospitality" program includes offers of housing, transportation, catering and so on to the corporate and/or well-heeled . the "Full Scale, Private Home Program," which will run you a mere $219,600 for the week, comes days after the announcement that a local Hooters restaurant is closing .

title: 'It's just not worth it': Why the Dodgers won't rush Ohtani -- no matter their record
content: Shohei Ohtani is the first 50/50 player in baseball history . he has attempted five steals in 12 games in august . it's a small part of a bigger conflict between what he can do and what the Dodgers believe .
